text: Vicente Ramón Roca Rodríguez (2 September 1792 - 23 February 1858) was President of Ecuador from 8 December 1845 to 15 October 1849. He was a member of the Liberal Party. He led the revolution that overthrew Juan José Flores, along with José Joaquín de Olmedo and Diego Noboa. He ruled under the Constitution of 1845. Roca was born on 2 September 1792 in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He was married to Juana Andrade. Roca died on 23 February 1858 from complications of pneumonia, aged 65. ==Other websites== * Official Website of the Ecuadorian Government about the country President's History Category:1792 births Category:1858 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Presidents of Ecuador Category:Politicians from Guayaquil
title: Vicente Ramón Roca
